participants.title: Participants
participants.createSubtitle: Fill in the new participant information
participants.familyCompositionDescription: This section allows you to document the participant's family structure. You can add as many family members as needed and remove those that don't apply.
participants.bioHistoryDescription: This section documents the participant's academic, work, and psychosocial history for better understanding of their context.
participants.consultationReasonInfo: Consultation reason according to the participant
participants.consultationReasonDescription: Document the main reason why the participant requests or is referred to the service.
participants.interventionPlanDescription: This section allows you to document the goals, objectives, and planned activities for the intervention with the participant.
participants.noInterventionItems: No items in the intervention plan
participants.progressNotesDescription: Record the participant's progress and evolution in each session or contact made.
participants.closingNoteDescription: Complete all fields to properly document the closure of the intervention process with the participant. This information is essential for program monitoring and evaluation.
participants.referralsDescription: Document referrals made to other services or professionals.

followUpPlan.title: G. FOLLOW-UP PLAN
followUpPlan.subtitle: Select the actions performed or planned

followUpPlan.servicesAgencyPlaceholder: E.g: Regional Hospital, Mental Health Center...

assessment.title: ASSESSMENT
assessment.generalDescriptionPlaceholder: Describe in detail the situation that prompted the consultation...
assessment.concurrentFactorsPlaceholder: Positive factors: family support, available resources, personal strengths...
assessment.criticalFactorsSubtitle: Describe conditions that do not favor the support process
assessment.criticalFactorsPlaceholder: Identified obstacles: lack of resources, resistance to change, risk situations...

assessment.theoreticalFrameworkSubtitle: Indicate the theoretical approach from which you will address the support process
assessment.theoreticalFrameworkPlaceholder: Theoretical framework: systemic approach, cognitive-behavioral, humanistic, etc...

interventionPlan.title: INTERVENTION PLAN
interventionPlan.noInterventionsMessage: No interventions have been added. Click 'Add Intervention' to begin.
interventionPlan.noteText: Each intervention must include clear goals, specific objectives and evaluation criteria to measure progress.

progressNotes.title: IV. PROGRESS NOTES
progressNotes.subtitle: Record the interventions performed
progressNotes.noNotesMessage: No progress notes have been added. Click 'Add Progress Note' to begin.
progressNotes.noteText: Record each intervention chronologically, including the date, time and relevant process details.

referrals.title: MENTION AND JUSTIFY THE REFERRALS THAT WILL BE MADE
referrals.justificationLabel: Description of Referrals and Their Justification
referrals.justificationSubtitle: Specify to which institutions, organizations or professionals the referrals will be made and explain the reasons that justify each one.
referrals.justificationPlaceholder: Describe the referrals that will be made and the justification for each one.
referrals.recommendation1: Be specific with the name of the institution or professional
referrals.recommendation2: Clearly justify why each referral is necessary
referrals.recommendation3: Mention what needs of the participant will be addressed
referrals.recommendation4: Indicate if there is prior coordination or established contact
